Closed issue "How to open SpreadsheetDocument without calcchain.xml" (#1281) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
### Discussed in https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK/discussions/1279
Originally posted by **Distancehe** December 22, 2022 The Excel file itself do not contain calcchain.xml, but calcchain.xml is referenced from workbook.xml.rels as below snapshot. When trying to load the excel with SpreadsheetDocument.Open(), it will throw exception since the calcchain.xml is missing. The question is, how to open the excel file with calcchain.xml missing? Is there some way to ignore this and continue open the file ? Thanks ! ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4394577/209112903-02252d47-95a6-4be0-a404-b3ff1ca45c63.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Use relationship filter for calcChain and recovered types" (#1341) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
This changes the relationship filtering to use the `IRelationshipFilterFeature` to register ignorable relationships. As part of this, the `OpenSettings.IgnoreExceptionOnCalcChainPartMissing` property has been removed and a new extension method has been added that can be opted into.

Fixes #1281

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Use relationship filter for calcChain and recovered types" (#1341) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK

Opened pull request "Refactor IPackage/IPackagePart to use IRelationshipCollection" (#1340) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Opened pull request "Refactor FlatOpc to be via extension methods" (#1339) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody: This maintains original API surface area, but moves it out of the package itself. This introduces IProgrammaticIdentifierFeature that allows a package to identify what the `mso-application` associated with the package is.

This had been in place for some performance issues in VS. It does make
development challenging, and with the refactoring of the framework from
the strongly typed classes, Visual Studio seems to handle this better.
